text.__SUMMARY__: Rhododendron nakaharae (那克哈杜鹃) is a rhododendron species native to northern Taiwan, where it grows at altitudes of 700–1000 meters. It is a low shrub that grows to 60 cm in height, with leaves that are ovate to oblong or oblanceolate to broad-elliptic, 0.6–1.2 by 0.5–1.2 cm in size. Flowers are red.
text.References:
"Rhododendron nakaharae", Hayata, J. Coll. Sci. Imp. Univ. Tokyo. 25(19): 153. 1908.
